verses.verse: Whither <S%H575><s%> is thy <S%H1730>beloved<s%> <S%H1980>gone,<s%> O thou <S%H3303>fairest<s%> among <S%H802>women?<s%> <S%H575>whither<s%> is thy <S%H1730>beloved<s%> turned <S%H6437>aside?<s%> that we may <S%H1245>seek<s%> him <S%H5973>with<s%> thee.

My <S%H1730>beloved<s%> is gone <S%H3381>down<s%> into his <S%H1588>garden,<s%> to the <S%H6170>beds<s%> of <S%H1314>spices,<s%> to <S%H7462>feed<s%> in the <S%H1588>gardens,<s%> and to <S%H3950>gather<s%> <S%H7799>lilies.<s%>
I <S%H589><s%> am my <S%H1730>beloved's,<s%> and my <S%H1730>beloved<s%> is mine: he <S%H7462>feedeth<s%> among the <S%H7799>lilies.<s%>
Thou <S%H859><s%> art <S%H3303>beautiful,<s%> O my <S%H7474>love,<s%> as <S%H8656>Tirzah,<s%> <S%H5000>comely<s%> as <S%H3389>Jerusalem,<s%> <S%H366>terrible<s%> as an army with <S%H1714>banners.<s%>

Turn <S%H5437>away<s%> thine <S%H5869>eyes<s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> <S%H5048><s%> me, for <S%H7945>they<s%> <S%H1992><s%> have <S%H7292>overcome<s%> me: thy <S%H8181>hair<s%> is as a <S%H5739>flock<s%> of <S%H5795>goats<s%> that <S%H7945>appear<s%> <S%H1570><s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> <S%H1568>Gilead.<s%>

Thy <S%H8127>teeth<s%> are as a <S%H5739>flock<s%> of <S%H7353>sheep<s%> which go <S%H7945>up<s%> <S%H5927><s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> the <S%H7367>washing,<s%> whereof every <S%H7945>one<s%> <S%H3605><s%> beareth <S%H8382>twins,<s%> and there is <S%H369>not<s%> one <S%H7909>barren<s%> among them.
As a <S%H6400>piece<s%> of a <S%H7416>pomegranate<s%> are thy <S%H7451>temples<s%> <S%H4480>within<s%> <S%H1157><s%> thy <S%H6777>locks.<s%>

My <S%H3123>dove,<s%> my <S%H8535>undefiled<s%> is but <S%H259>one;<s%> <S%H1931>she<s%> is the only <S%H259>one<s%> of her <S%H517>mother,<s%> <S%H1931>she<s%> is the <S%H1249>choice<s%> one of her that <S%H3205>bore<s%> her. The <S%H1323>daughters<s%> <S%H7200>saw<s%> her, and <S%H833>blessed<s%> her; yea, the <S%H4436>queens<s%> and the <S%H6370>concubines,<s%> and they <S%H1984>praised<s%> her.

Who <S%H4310><s%> is <S%H2063>she<s%> that looketh <S%H8259>forth<s%> as the <S%H7837>morning,<s%> <S%H3303>fair<s%> as the <S%H3842>moon,<s%> <S%H1249>clear<s%> as the <S%H2535>sun,<s%> and <S%H366>terrible<s%> as an army with <S%H1713>banners?<s%>

I went <S%H3381>down<s%> <S%H413>into<s%> the <S%H1594>garden<s%> of <S%H93>nuts<s%> to <S%H7200>see<s%> the <S%H3>fruits<s%> of the <S%H5158>valley,<s%> and to <S%H7200>see<s%> whether the <S%H1612>vine<s%> <S%H6524>flourished,<s%> and the <S%H7416>pomegranates<s%> <S%H5132>budded.<s%>
Or <S%H3808>ever<s%> I was <S%H3045>aware,<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H7760>made<s%> me like the <S%H4818>chariots<s%> of <S%H5971>Ammi-nadib.<s%> <S%H5081><s%>

Return, <S%H7725><s%> <S%H7725>return,<s%> O <S%H7759>Shulamite;<s%> <S%H7725>return,<s%> <S%H7725>return,<s%> that we may <S%H2372>look<s%> upon thee. <S%H4100>What<s%> will ye <S%H2372>see<s%> in the <S%H7759>Shulamite?<s%> As it were the <S%H4246>company<s%> of two <S%H4264>armies.<s%>
